turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I want you to check this out, Ellie.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: The bartender at Darrow's.  He was there Friday night.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: This murder was in the papers, right?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Call all of them from here to Anchorage. Tell them we now know that Kay Connell left the party with a dark blue knapsack, but we haven't recovered it yet.  We can get it in by the morning editions.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I could say the same thing about you.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Oh.  We always have play-offs in the middle of the night.  It's the best time.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: The Puffins and the Hawks.  We're in extra innings.  The Hawks have a really good line-up this year.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: It's okay.  Happened a long time ago.  He was killed in a fire.  In New Mexico.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: That must have been awful for you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm going back to the Lodge, Ellie. Still need to go through some of Kay Connell's school records.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: But here's the thing.  I retraced your exact steps according to your statement. You couldn't have seen Detective Eckhart from there.  I mean, not in that fog.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: How much closer would you say you were?

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: About an hour ago.  Said he was more than happy to cooperate.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Isn't that the difference between a good cop and a bad cop?  A good cop can't sleep 'cause a piece of the puzzle's missing.  A bad cop can't sleep 'cause his conscience won't let him.  You said that once, remember?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Walter Byrd killed Kay Connell.  Her things are in the house.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No.  But I covered it up.  I lied.

turns.speaker: ELLIE
turns.text: Don't worry.  I'll have a cool scar.

turns.speaker: FARRELL
turns.text: I wish I'd had the chance to get to know him better.  Take him fishing or something.

turns.speaker: FARRELL
turns.text: We just gotta catch the bastard, right?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: That's why I'm here.  I need to know exactly what you saw yesterday, Farrell.

turns.speaker: FARRELL
turns.text: Oh, you know.  Don't feel that much. Bullet went right through.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Right.  Got lost in the rocks.

turns.speaker: FARRELL
turns.text: We'll get the other one, though.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Like I said, no.  We know about those things up here.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: She left the party early.  Friends said she had a fight with her boyfriend and stormed out.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Who was the last one to see her alive?

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Randy Stetz.  Her boyfriend.  We've questioned him, searched his place. Didn't find anything.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I'll stick it in the evidence locker...

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Dormer.  Still no sign of the bullet that went through Farrell.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm going to the hospital to talk to him now.  You get the search party together.  No fewer than thirty people.  I'll meet you in exactly twenty-five minutes.  Don't waste any time.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: First I need a copy of the key.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: I beeped you over two hours ago.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: And something else that might interest you.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: One of the paperbacks we found in Kay Connell's knapsack.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: Mrs. Connell found this copy in the house.  It's signed.  Personally.

turns.speaker: FRED
turns.text: This is a local writer.  Kay had all his books.  I think we should check it out.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: She flattered me about my writing.  Asked if she could visit me.  To talk about my books.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Yes.  Not that much at first.  But then she became more comfortable.  Started visiting me every week...

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: She wasn't happy.  I was someone to talk to.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: She'd come to me, sometimes in the middle of the night.  Bruises all over her back, her upper arms.  I pled with her to let me call the police, but she wouldn't hear it.  Wanted to keep it a secret.

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: I.A.'s calling themselves the "Corruption Task Force."  Can you believe that? Trying to root out any mistakes or "oversights" any other Detectives may have made over the years.  They're turning it into a witch hunt.  Something on the news about it practically every night.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: He knew exactly what we'd be looking for. Made sure to cover up all his tracks.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What do you want to talk about?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We'll talk when we get back to Seattle.

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: When's that, a week?  Two weeks?...  We have to figure out a plan of action now.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You know my plan of action.

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: Dammit, Will. Warfield had me locked up in his office again for five hours yesterday. Five hours. Asking all kinds of questions...

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: But he's zeroing in on me. On us. Everyone's talking about it.

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: Well, I gotta tell you.  With a wife, three kids, and a pension plan in the balance, it's rattling hard.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We say nothing.  It goes away.  Simple as that.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Weston Dobbs killed an eight year-old boy and left him hanging in the basement like a piece of meat.  You remember that?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: One word to I.A. and he walks.

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: Maybe not.  We could talk to Buck...

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: Cut some kind of a deal.  I heard that's what Flynn's doing...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Mike Flynn's a dirty cop, Hap! We are nothing like Mike Flynn. We did what we needed to do to make sure that son-of- bitch Dobbs paid for what he did. And every bastard like him. We say one word about it and every case we ever brought in is going to blow wide open and they'll all walk. Every last one. And I am not going to let that happen. No deals. No compromises. No discussions.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Well her mother didn't buy them for her.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Looks like the natives are restless.

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: I wish I could stick it out like you.  I just, with Trish and the kids...

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: I'm thinking I could get off with probation.  Keep half my pension.  That's all I want.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Goddammit, Hap.  Think about what you're doing...

turns.speaker: HAP
turns.text: You don't have to be involved, Will.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You tell Buck and I'm involved whether I like it or not...

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: I got it.  Don't know why I bother.  It's been broken for two years.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: No.  He didn't say what his name was. Only that you were expecting him.

turns.speaker: RACHEL
turns.text: There's a guy down the hall.  Complaining about the noise.  Says he can't sleep.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Me and Hap.  A year and a half ago.  I knew the second I met Dobbs that he was guilty.  Smug, cold.  Dead eyes.  We had circumstantial evidence, but nothing to tie him to it.  Nothing concrete.  Went over every inch of that apartment.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: There've been other cases.  Where we've changed results.  Pushed witnesses. Manipulated evidence.  But Dobbs.  I wanted Dobbs more than anything.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We're under investigation now.  Back in Seattle.  Hap wanted to talk.  As soon as we got back.  Thought he could work out some kind of deal.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Kay Connell.  Did you love her?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: "She was nice."  Wow.  That makes me all soft inside.  Ever occur to you she didn't love you back?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: She loved me.  She wanted to see me every night.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: But she was seeing someone else on the side.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I don't know what you're fucking talking about.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Friday night, at the party - what'd you fight about?

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Just stuff.  I don't fucking remember.

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: I told you I don't remember.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: After that she left the party to go to him.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Ran like hell to go to him...

turns.speaker: RANDY
turns.text: Fuck you, man! - I'm sick of all your fucking cop questions...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Good to see you, too, Randy.

turns.speaker: TANYA
turns.text: I never met anyone from Seattle before.

turns.speaker: TANYA
turns.text: What are you doing in this shit-hole town?

turns.speaker: TANYA
turns.text: We were like sisters.  Knew everything about each other.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Must be tough for you.  What happened.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You want me to take you somewhere?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You and Kay were like sisters?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Told each other everything.  That why your picture's torn up in the top drawer of her bureau?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Who was Kay seeing besides Randy Stetz?

turns.speaker: TANYA
turns.text: It was like some big fucking secret!

turns.speaker: TANYA
turns.text: She kept saying she was gonna get out of here. Leave us all behind. That he was going to take her!

turns.speaker: TANYA
turns.text: She used some stupid code name.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I said you're going to get a phone call.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Kay Connell had a signed copy of one of your books.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You're going to be brought in for questioning.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: But she was an attractive girl.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Did you have sex with her?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I was a mentor to her.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Doesn't sound like a mentor to me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I gave her things she didn't have. Couldn't have.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Told you I could write an ending.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I thought maybe we could talk some more.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: There's nothing more to talk about.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: But we work so well together...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What the hell do you know?

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: Kay told me.  She comes to me, you know. Tells me things.  About you.  About me.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I told you that was an accident!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Don't you pull that shit with me.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: I didn't want to kill her, Will.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: It was when I went to kiss her.  She started laughing.  I got angry.  After all I'd given her.  All I'd shared with her.  I just wanted to make her stop. That's all.

turns.speaker: WALTER
turns.text: If you want it to be...

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Procedure went out the window a long time ago.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: They did, but too fast for you to see them. No magic, just grace and speed.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Disappointing, isn't it? To come so far and find so little. Jaded ingenues, amusing themselves with make- believe...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We had feared we were the only ones...

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: But how did you come into existence?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: You don't want to answer... Two vampires from the new world, come to guide us into the new era as all we love slowly rots and fades away.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Are you the leader of tis group?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: If there were a leader, I would be the one.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Who made us what we are?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Surely you know the one who made you...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: But the one who made him, who made the one who made him, the source of all this evil...

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: That is a picture, nothing more.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You mean we are not children of Satan?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: I understand. I saw you in the theatre, your suffering, your sympathy for that girl. I saw you with the boy. You die when you kill, you feel you deserve to die and you stint on nothing. But does that make you evil? Or, since you comprehend what you call goodness, does it not make you good?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: And perhaps this is the only real evil left...

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: I have not spoken to him...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And no vampire here has discourse with God or the Devil?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: None that I've ever known. I know nothing of God or the Devil, I have never seen a vision nor learnt a secret that would damn or save my soul. And as far as I know, after four hundred years I am the oldest living vampire in the world.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: My God... So it's as I always feared. Nothing, leading to nothing.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: You fell too much. So much you make me feel...

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: The one who made you should have told you this. The one who left the old world for the new...

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: He knew nothing. He just didn't care.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Claudia is dear to me. My... daughter.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: If you say so. You are innocent.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I'm not innocent. But I'm afraid. She feels she's in danger from the others.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: I could give you reasons. Her silence. Her youth. It's forbidden to make so young, so helpless, that cannot survive on its own.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Then blame the one who made her...

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Did you kill this vampire who made you both? Is that why you won't say his name? Santiago thinks you did.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: We want no quarrel with him.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: It's already begun. If you want to save her, send her away.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: So soon? Without any of those answers you so longed for?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: But you asked the wrong questions. Do you know how few vampires have the stamina for immortality? How quickly they perish of their own will.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: You would never give up life. If the world were reduced to one empty cell, on fragile candle, you stay alive and study it. You see too clearly. You see too much.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: That's what the one who made me said.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: How he must have loved you.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And the vampires of the Theatre?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Like moths around the candle of the age. Decadent, useless. They can't reflect anything. But you do. You reflect its broken heart.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Are these not the answers you came for?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: A vampire with a human soul. An immortal with a mortal's passion. You are beautiful, my friend. Lestat must have wept when he made you --

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Yes I knew him. Knew him well enough not to mourn his passing.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Follow me - that way - through my cell -

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: Not without Claudia. Where is she?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You can't believe I'd leave without her. Armand! You must save her! You have no choice.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Louis, I can't save her. I will only risk losing you -

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I don't believe you. I do not have to read your soul to know that you lie.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Louis, they cannot be brought back. There are some things that are impossible, even for me.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You held sway over them. They feared you. You wanted it to happen.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: Louis, I swear I did not.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: I understand you only too well. You let them do it, as I let Lestat turn a child into a demon. As I let her rip Lestat's heart to pieces! Well I am no longer that passive fool that has spun evil from evil till the web traps the one who made it. Your melancholy spirit of this century! I know what I must do. And i warn you - you saved me tonight, so I return the favour - do not go near your cell in the Theatre Des Vampires again.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You didn't even warm them, did you?

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: And yet you knew what I would o.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: I knew. I rescued you, didn't I? From the terrible dawn.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: You were their leader. They trusted you.

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: You made me see their failings, Louis. You made me look at them with your eyes.

turns.speaker: LOUIS
turns.text: What a pair we are. We deserve each other, don't we?

turns.speaker: ARMAND
turns.text: We are a pair, and that's what counts.

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: Yes, cherie, of course you want more. And I'll show you how to get it. You drink from morals, my beauty, but from me? Never again.

turns.speaker: LESTAT
turns.text: It's bet in the beginning, lest the death takes you down with it. yes, that's it. My child. My beloved child.
